intro: Clermontia macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf clermonthe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. It has broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Clermontia macrophylla is considered an endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species.
